intro: Boronia anethifolia var. variabilis, commonly known as the variable boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. The species exhibits variability in leaf shape and flower color, contributing to its common name.
